intro: Microcoelia macrorrhynchia, commonly known as the large-beaked microcoelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Microcoelia macrorrhynchia is a perennial species that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
